publicationStmt.p: Digital edition hosted on http://rickandmorty.newtfire.org and GitHub: https://github.com/dorothealint/Rick-and-Morty

encodingDesc.p: Some small changes to the original transcriptions were made including fixed spelling errors and getting rid of parentheses, brackes, and colons.

body.stage: Open Ext. Smith residence
Outside, there is snow on the ground. The Smith house is decorated for Christmas, and Jerry can be heard singing Last King Christmas.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: singing Last King Christmas last arrived!

body.stage: Trans Int. Kitchen
The kitchen is a mess of food in various stages of preparation. Jerry pulls a ham out of the oven as he sings.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: singing In the Christmas Christmas! stops singing and smells the ham Mmm... Jerry, you are really giving it to this ham.

body.stage: Jerry enters the living room, where a tree stands with presents underneath it. Beth and Morty are occupied on tablets while Summer uses her smartphone.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Um, Merry Christmas? puts his hands on his hips Helloooo? My parents are coming over for the first time in years! Can we stow the gadgets and look alive?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Alive? For your parents?

body.stage: Jerry snags her tablet away and stows it in a stocking.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Good one.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Hey man!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: You 'hey man'! This holiday is about humanity.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: not looking up from his tablet You know, I thought it was about being born half-God or something.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Okay, whatever. All electronic items are going in the stocking. Now.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: hands over his tablet Ohhhh...

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Dad, I'm not giving you my phone.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Put it in the stocking, Summer, or I'm joining Facebook.

body.stage: Summer gasps and drops her phone in the stocking.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: offscreen Ho ho ho, everybody.

body.stage: Rick and Ruben enter the house and Jerry approaches them.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: More like whoa whoa whoa. What is this? My parents are coming!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Calm down Jerry, this is Ruben, an old friend.

sp.speaker: Ruben
sp.p: Pearl Harbor.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: I check in on him once a year and give him a little burp medical burp evaluation.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Aw, Dad... That is so sweet.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: squinting suspiciously Yeah, it is... I don't get it.

sp.speaker: Ruben
sp.p: Korea.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Don't worry about your C-C-Christmas, Jerry. leads Ruben away Ruben and I'll be in my workshop while you have another day in Phil Collins' proverbial paradise.

body.stage: Rick and Ruben head out to the garage.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Huh. You think you know a guy. The doorbell rings. Okay, there's my parents. Now remember, no TV, no phones, no laptops, we are connecting this Christmas, like old-school Jews on a Saturday. opens the door Hey hey!

body.stage: Leonard and Joyce walk in.

sp.speaker: Leonard
sp.p: Merry Christmas, son.

body.stage: Jerry, not noticing Jacob, almost closes the door on him, then opens it back up.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Oh, hi. Can I help you?

sp.speaker: Joyce
sp.p: Jerry, this is Jacob. takes Jacob by the arm Didn't you get our text message?

sp.speaker: Beth, Summer, and Morty
sp.p: No.

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: You must be Jerry! That's a fine lookin' apron. William Sonoma?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: smiling uncomfortably I wish... But thank you. closes the door So... you're a...friend of the family...?

sp.speaker: Leonard
sp.p: puts an arm around Jacob's shoulders The way we see it, he's a part of the family.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Wow!

sp.speaker: Joyce
sp.p: After your father's brush with cancer and losing your uncle, we looked at life and wondered how have we spent it? And how do we spend the rest of it? What are we going to be when we die? A list of fears and questions, or a collection of real experiences?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Holy crap, Joyce. That's amazing.

sp.speaker: Leonard
sp.p: Then Jacob came into our lives. We're learning to live again.

body.stage: Jacob puts his arms around Joyce and Leonard.

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: All three of us.

body.stage: Joyce, Leonard, and Jacob giggle. Jerry stares at them, confused and uncomfortable.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: ...Cool... Eggnog?

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: Now we are talkin'! This man's got the apron and the eggnog, huh?

body.stage: All laugh. Rick enters and starts laughing with the rest.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Hi Joyce, Leonard. looks at Jacob Hello there.

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: Merry Christmas, man.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Morty! A moment of your time?

body.stage: Trans. Rick's garage
Ruben is in fits, laid out on a ping-pong table. He's naked besides a towel over his genitals and his Santa hat.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: He's in bad shape, Morty.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Aw geez, Rick! What did you do?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Gee, thanks Morty. What kind of monster do you think I am? I-I'm sittin' here trying to save the guy's life! Rick straps a pack with a tube onto Morty's back and puts an earpiece on his head. I want you to find Dr. Xenon Bloom. He'll know what's goin' on.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: extremely nervous Uh... W-W-Where do I find Dr. Bloom?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: In Ruben. shoves a glass oxygen mask onto Morty's head

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Ruben... Minnesota?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Ruben on the table, Morty! hooks up the backpack to the helmet Look, I-I don't have time for you to wrap your little walnut around everything. pulls a shrink ray into view and plugs it in Hold your breath until the process is over or your lungs will collapse.

body.stage: Rick sets Morty under the shrink ray.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: W-What proc—

body.stage: Rick activates the shrink ray and Morty shrieks as he's shrunk down to a microscopic size. Rick picks up the container Morty shrank into and puts it into a syringe, which he stabs into Ruben's chest. Just then, Beth enters the garage.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Hey Dad, where's Morty?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: He's busy.

body.stage: Trans. Int. Ruben's body
Morty continues screaming as he is injected into the body in a stream of pink fluid. He lands on something soft and abruptly stops shouting.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: through Morty's earpiece Morty, can you hear me? Head North!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Rick... Where am I?

body.stage: Trans. Garage

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: adjusts his own headset as he stands in the garage Depending on my aim, you should be just south of the entrance.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: through Rick's earpieceThe entrance to what?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Welcome, Morty. The scene cuts back to Morty's view from inside Ruben. Welcome... Morty gasps. ...to Anatomy Park!

body.stage: The view pans to show an amusement park with a large Anatomy Park sign and various attractions and exhibits.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: It's a little business venture I've been cookin' up on the side with Dr. Bloom. Morty enters the park. An amusement park inside a human body. Science isn't cheap, Morty. This should really help put a dent in the overhead.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh my God! This is insane! Spleen Mountain? Bladder Falls? Pirates of the Pancreas?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: You got a problem with that last one, Morty?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Huh? No, no, I'm just reading them out loud in the order I'm seeing them.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Okay, alright, if I sounded a little defensive, it's because Pirates of the Pancreas was my baby.

body.stage: Trans. Garage

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: I-I got a lot of push-back when I pitched it, Morty. I guess I'm still a little defensive. Let's just find Dr. Bloom, alright? I-I'm picking up a distress signal in the liver, Morty.

body.stage: Trans. Anatomy Park.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Proceed to the liver.

body.stage: Following a sign posting directions, Morty hurries off in the direction of the 'Haunted Liver,' taking a shuttle to 'Lower Abdomenland'.

sp.speaker: Automated voice
sp.p: Arriving at 'Liver'.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: stumbles forward and hits his helmet on the window Ow!

sp.speaker: Automated voice
sp.p: Mind the gap.

body.stage: Morty exits the train and enters a dark, unkempt area with flickering lights.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: It's really scary in here, Rick.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Liver's under maintenance. Ruben's seen some rough years, Morty. Don't judge. You don't agree to have a theme park built inside you if your life's going great.

body.stage: Trans. Int. Haunted Liver
Morty enters a haunted house-style attraction. An animatronic wolf suddenly springs up behind him.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: OOOOHHH! Rick, it's a monster!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: No no, Morty. The only monster here is alco— belch —holism. The wolf is mechanically pulled back into the wall. That is an animatronic werewolf.

body.stage: A hand reaches from around the corner and a large, muscular man with a thick accent grips Morty by the throat, lifting him up and pinning him to the wall with his forearm.

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: Who are you? Answer me! Where did you come from?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Mmm! M-M-My-my-my Grandpa Rick sent me!

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Poncho! That's quite enough.

body.stage: Dr. Bloom walks into the room. He appears to be a blob of goo in a roughly human shape with glasses and a walking cane. Poncho glares, then reluctantly lets Morty fall to the ground.

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Morty, that's Poncho. Another man and a girl walk into the room. This is Roger and Annie.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: staring sheepishly at Annie Oh...

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: And I am Dr. Xenon Bloom.

body.stage: A speaker apparatus emerges from Morty's helmet. Rick speaks through it.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Hey Bloom, it's Rick. What the hell's goin' on here?

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: I don't know why, but the entire security system has shut down. And I'm afraid the exhibits are unlocked.

body.stage: Rick's speaker retreats into Morty's helmet.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Exhibits?

body.stage: Trans. Ext. Haunted Liver

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Anatomy Park's greatest attraction, young man, isn't the music or the food or the Pirates of the Pancreas.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Watch it.

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: It is first and foremost a living museum of humanity's most noble and ferocious diseases.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Diseases?!

body.stage: There's a distant roaring noise.

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: Hey Doc, I have news for ya. Hepatitis A lumbers towards the group. Your living museum is officially a wild safari!

body.stage: Poncho begins shooting at Hepatitis A.

sp.speaker: Roger
sp.p: Hepatitis A! Run!

body.stage: The entire group screams and flees.
Trans. Dining room
The Smith family, sans Rick and Morty, are seated for dinner with Joyce, Leonard, and Jacob.

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: Oh... leans over and wipes some food from Joyce's mouth with a napkin The food goes in your mouth, girl!

body.stage: All laugh, but Jerry's laugh is forced.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Aha... I'm sorry Jacob, I guess I'm still confused about the precise nature and origin of your relationship with my parents. Are you like a—Are you like their caretaker? Is that what it is?

sp.speaker: Joyce
sp.p: We can go into detail later, son.

sp.speaker: Leonard
sp.p: Now wait, there, there's no point to secrecy. Let's all live and die honestly. Your mother and I have shared forty years of each other, mind, body, and soul. Jerry and Jacob smile at each other, but when Jacob looks away, Jerry's smile becomes a glare. And when minds and souls are joined for eternity, and when eternity is at the door, it's an invitation to let go of the body, and an opportunity to share and experiment.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Dad, please, what are you saying?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Whatever it is, it's beautiful Leonard. glares at Jerry And we support you.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Speak for yourself! Because it, heheh, it sounds like you're about to say Jacob is your lover.

sp.speaker: Leonard
sp.p: No no no no no no. Jerry sighs in relief. Jacob is your mother's lover. Jerry again looks disturbed. I watch them. Sometimes from a chair, sometimes from a closet. Almost always dressed as Superman.

body.stage: Joyce kisses Leonard's cheek and the two hold hands, looking at each other fondly.

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: Oh... reaches across the table and puts a hand atop theirs

body.stage: Summer and Beth smile. Jerry stares, at a loss for words.

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: Jerry, this ham's got to be all you, right? It's in-cred-i-ble.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: smirks Happy human holiday, Dad.

body.stage: Jerry appears more despondent than ever.
Trans. Anatomy Park
Poncho continues shooting at Hepatitis A.

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: AHHHHHH!

body.stage: The whole group rushes through a door before entering a code and shutting it.

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Hepatitis won't follow us into the respiratory system!

body.stage: They enter to a set of doors under a sign reading 'Alveoli Forest'. Roger examines a meter near the door.

sp.speaker: Roger
sp.p: That's strange... taps the meter Air flow is down twenty percent.

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: So the brain isn't getting enough oxygen. That's why security is offline.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: W-Well, I guess we better check it out.

body.stage: The group passes through the doors. As the doors are closing, Alexander, dressed in a dog mascot costume, rushes up and passes through.

sp.speaker: Alexander
sp.p: Hey, wait for me! removes the head of his costume

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: points his cane at Alexander Put that back on!

body.stage: Alexander pauses a moment before putting the dog head back on. The whole group examines the area.

sp.speaker: Roger
sp.p: If we got up to the bronchial catwalk, we could look for blockage.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: raises his hand I'll go. glances at Annie Heheh...

body.stage: Morty jumps onto one of the bouncy, round alveoli and clings to it.

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: Don't be a hero, kid.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I'm not. I'm doin' it because it's fun. he hops from frond to frond

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: cocks his gun We shouldn't be here.

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Whatever you do, don't fire that thing in here! We must save Ruben. This is my life's work.

body.stage: Annie touches a growth of bacteria on some tar, which squelches, causing her to gasp in fear and recoil.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: Ah!

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: It's alright, my dear. Nearly all human lungs contain a strain of this bacteria, but the scar tissue... prods it with his cane, seeing something has escaped from the scar tissue ...keeps them dormant. looks up toward Morty, who is getting close to the catwalk Morty! Get down!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Whoa! grabs hold of the catwalk as a fluid drips down onto it Whoa!

body.stage: Tuberculosis begins crawling towards him. He lets go of the catwalk and bounces back down to the group, pursued by the disease.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh! What are those things?!

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Tuberculosis, coming in fast!

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: raises gun and starts shooting at the disease Not faster than a bullet! Ahh!

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: grabs Poncho's arm No! Do you know what you've done?!

body.stage: Trans. Garage
Ruben coughs.
Trans. Lungs
The force of the cough lifts the whole group off the ground, then they fall back down.

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Get to the digestive tract! He's coughing!

body.stage: The group starts running.
Trans. Garage
Ruben coughs several times again.
Trans. Lungs
The group all manages to push through besides Alexander. Morty rushes back to help him as his dog mask is blown from his face. Morty grabs a frond and reaches for Alexander's hand.

sp.speaker: Alexander
sp.p: Waaaah! Don't let me die!

body.stage: Trans. Garage
Rick looks down over Ruben's mouth.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Just take a deep breath, Ruben.

body.stage: Ruben inhales deeply.
Trans. Lungs

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: You're not gonna die! What's your name?

sp.speaker: Alexander
sp.p: My name is... his hand slips from Morty's and he's coughed up ALEXANDEEEEEEEER!

body.stage: Alexander's skin and soft tissue are peeled off as Ruben coughs into Rick's face, getting some spittle, including Alexander, on Rick's forehead.
The group, minus the now-dead Alexander, escape the respiratory system. Morty presses the speaker on his helmet.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Rick! Ruben's got tuberculosis!

body.stage: Trans. Garage

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, great work, Morty. pulls a massive syringe form his lab coat I'll just cure it, and then—

body.stage: Ruben's heart monitor flatlines. Rick tosses the syringe over his shoulder.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Okay. Well I can't cure death. This is bad, Morty. You're trapped in a dead man. Listen, if the situation keeps darkening, do yourself a favor—

body.stage: Trans. Anatomy Park

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: —and hop by Pirates of the Pancreas. Obviously I'm biased, but, I think it's great, Morty.

body.stage: Trans. Garage

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: sitting in a lounge chair, pulls out a flask It's a bunch of pirates runnin' around a-a-a- pancreas. We don't whitewash it either, Morty. The pirates are really rapey. The top priority is to get you guys out of there, but I'm just saying, if that becomes impossible—

body.stage: Trans. Anatomy Park
The group listens to Rick, all looking glum.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: —please, you gotta treat yourself.

body.stage: The group is headed to the digestive tract.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Geez, what's that horrible smell?

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: You mean the Panda Express? chuckles Kidding, I-I'm kidding. As he speaks, Poncho and Roger stock up on bottled water from the Panda Express. The body is beginning to constrict and fill with gas. We're inside a corpse, my boy. Anatomy Park is doomed.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Forget about the park, Doctor! How do we get out?!

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: The digestive tract is the evacuation route. Get it? There's an emergency station in the colon with a ray that can enlarge us all.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Everybody! Get to the colon!

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: Now I'm takin' orders from a twelve-year-old boy?!

body.stage: As they walk, Dr. Bloom speaks privately with Morty.

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Morty. The scar sacs containing the tuberculosis were sabotaged. This disaster was an inside job. Keep your eyes on Annie. She was written up several times by her manager at the churro stand.

sp.speaker: Roger
sp.p: Intestines are ahead to the left. Then the right. Then left. Et cetera.

body.stage: Morty slows to walk beside Annie.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Hey, just so you know, I-I'm actually fourteen. So, you know...

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: What?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Not twelve.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: Okay.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Because he just said I was twelve.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: Oh. Good for you.

body.stage: She walks ahead of him.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: through speakerOh. Oh, Morty. Strike one.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: slumps forward Nnn...

body.stage: Trans. Small intestine
The group travel down the small intestine in a raft, surrounded by animatronics singing 'It's a Small, Small Intestine.'

sp.speaker: Animatronics
sp.p: singing It's a road of laughter, a trail of food. It's a pathway that breaks up the fat in food. It's a tube in the chest and it sends out the rest. It's a small, small intestine!

sp.speaker: Roger
sp.p: It goes on like this for miles...

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: excitedly And then we get to the large intestine!

body.stage: A low rumbling can be heard.

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: Shh. shines flashlight I hear something.

body.stage: Gonorrhea rises up from the river of waste.

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: whispers Don't move. Gonorrhea can't see us if we don't move.

body.stage: Gonorrhea roars viciously and moves towards them.

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Wait! I was wrong! I was thinking of a T-rex.

body.stage: Poncho pulls out a gun, but before he can fire, Gonorrhea capsizes the boat and they all fall overboard. They swim to the 'shore' on the side of the intestine.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: We're sitting ducks!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Doc! Didn't you say the body was filling up with gas?

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Yes. Why?

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: Kid! You're a genius! pulls out a match

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Are you mad?!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: grabs Annie's hand Everybody! In here!

body.stage: They all rush into a cavity in the intestinal lining. Poncho lights the match.

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: Hey Gonorrhea! How's this for a burning sensation?

body.stage: He throws the match towards the disease, where it ignites the gas and causes an explosion. Gonorrhea falls down, dead. Annie hugs Morty, who laughs.
Trans. Smith family living room
Leonard, Summer, Joyce, Jacob, Beth, and Jerry sit in a semicircle on the carpet. Jerry scowls and slumps. Leonard is playing a set of bongos while Summer sings.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: singing Drummer, drum, drum, drum! Drummer, drum, drum drum drum, Christmas drums!

sp.speaker: Leonard
sp.p: Oh, Summer. Sing it! Haha.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Christmas drums being played by a boy!

body.stage: Beth is clapping along when she notices Jerry sulking. She puts an arm around him.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Jerry, come on. This is what you wanted.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: I get it, Beth. Be careful what you wish for. I'm being punished for taking your iPad.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: What? Jerry, let that stuff go, okay? I'm sorry I was a bitch earlier. Let's just be here.

body.stage: Ethan walks up to the sliding glass doors and lets himself into the house.

sp.speaker: Ethan
sp.p: Ugh... Summer!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: stands up Ethan, what are you doing here?

sp.speaker: Ethan
sp.p: I've been texting you for hours. What the hell?!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: I don't have my phone! I'm doing a human holiday!

sp.speaker: Ethan
sp.p: Did you even consider how that might make me feel?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: How you feel? Why is everything always happening to you?!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: stands up Summer, do you have a boyfriend?

sp.speaker: Ethan
sp.p: Yeah, do you, Summer?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: I don't know Ethan, do I?

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: stands up and puts a hand on Ethan and Summer's shoulders Jerry, no disrespect, but you really need to connect more with your family, man.

body.stage: Jerry stares at him, flabbergasted.
Trans. Anatomy Park
The group runs through another metal security door and hurry down a platform to a growth ray.

sp.speaker: Roger
sp.p: I should be able to access the backup generator to get the growth ray back online. If it works, we'll be regular-sized in a few minutes. I just hope Ruben's not in a room with white carpets or upholstery.

body.stage: Something roars in the distance, causing the area to rumble.

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: What the hell is that?

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: The sphincter dam. We built it when Ruben became incontinent, but it was not designed to hold a corpse-load.

body.stage: The dam is clearly close to giving way. Roger keeps working to get the growth ray active.

sp.speaker: Roger
sp.p: Almost got it. Everybody, move inside the circle!

body.stage: Morty notices a strange, black creature in Poncho's backpack.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Poncho? What is this in your backpack?

body.stage: Poncho turns around to face Morty, giving Dr. Bloom a view of the creature.

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: That's bubonic plague! What are you doing with that, Poncho?

body.stage: Poncho grabs hold of Annie and holds a knife to her throat. Annie gasps and tries to kick free.

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: Everybody get back!

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Poncho, you son of a bitch! You released the tuberculosis so you could steal from me?

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: laughs That's right, baby. A lot of people would pay top dollar to decimate the population. I'll take the highest bidder. Al Quaeda. North Korea. Republicans! Shriners! Balding men that work out! People on the Internet that are only turned on by cartoons of Japanese teenagers! Anything is better than working for you! points the knife at Dr. Bloom You pompous, negligent, iTunes Gift Card as a holiday bonus-giving—

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: AHHHHH!!!

body.stage: Morty leaps up and grabs onto Poncho's helmet, allowing Annie to escape. He punches Poncho repeatedly before Poncho pulls him off his face and throws him to the ground, where Roger helps him up. Poncho laughs evilly, but stops short when Bubonic Plague bites his shoulder.

sp.speaker: Poncho
sp.p: Ah! Eh! Get! Get off! he backs up and falls over the railing Ahhhh!

body.stage: The four remaining look over the edge as he falls to his death. Just then, the sphincter dam begins groaning, almost giving way.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: You guys!

sp.speaker: Roger
sp.p: It's gonna burst! urges the others on Go! Go, go, go! pulls a lever before trying to run after the others but catches his foot in some of the machinery My foot is stuck!

body.stage: Morty holds Annie back as she makes to help Roger.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: No!

sp.speaker: Roger
sp.p: This is okay! It's okay, just go! Tell my family I love them! They may be hard to find because my wife kept her last name and she made the kids take it too, so, I dunno, you can—

body.stage: Just then, the dam bursts, drowning Roger in Ruben's excrement.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: No!

body.stage: Dr. Bloom seals the door to the chamber and Annie hugs Morty, distraught and crying.
Trans. Smith family living room
Leonard, Joyce, and Beth sit on the chair and sofa, Jerry and Summer stand, and Jacob kneels with Ethan in the center of the room.

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: Let me ask you something Ethan. Where's the anger coming from, man?

sp.speaker: Ethan
sp.p: From Summer being a total bitch!

body.stage: Jacob takes hold of Ethan's cheeks and forces him to make eye contact.

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: Where's the anger coming from?

sp.speaker: Ethan
sp.p: ...My brother... took me fishing once...in the bushes... voice begins choking up as tears fill his eyes I can't... I can't! covers his eyes as he starts to cry He made me feel like a girl! sobbing openly I'm... m-made me a girl!

body.stage: Jacob helps Ethan up to his feet.

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: He didn't make you anything, man. You are who you are. gestures to Summer She is who she is. Summer watches on with a sympathetic expression. Now you go to her. Brand new.

body.stage: Ethan walks over to Summer.

sp.speaker: Ethan
sp.p: Come here right now!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Oh my god, I'm so sorry Ethan! they hug I love you!

sp.speaker: Ethan
sp.p: I love you so much.

body.stage: The two begin making out. Everyone claps besides Jerry.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Um...

sp.speaker: Joyce
sp.p: You did it again, cubby. Come here.

body.stage: Joyce and Jacob begin to kiss. Jerry looks to the easy chair to see Leonard has gotten up and is backing into the closet, unbuttoning his shirt to reveal a Superman costume underneath.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: No! Stop! I hate this!

body.stage: Beth, Joyce, and Jacob glare at him.

sp.speaker: Joyce
sp.p: Well, Christmas doesn't revolve around what you hate, son.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Well then, I hate Christmas! Enjoy being human! You guys are gross and lame.

body.stage: He walks out. Summer and Ethan and Joyce and Jacob continue kissing.
Trans. Anatomy Park

The three survivors are in a small theater where an animatronic Ruben gives a presentation. Morty and Annie have their helmets off and are making out, and Dr. Bloom sits a few seats away eating ice cream.

sp.speaker: Animatronic Ruben
sp.p: My name's Ruben Ridley. You're inside me right now, but by the end of this journey, I'll be inside all of you.

body.stage: Dr. Bloom appears to miss every other bite of ice cream, probably due to his semi-aqueous form.

sp.speaker: Animatronic Ruben
sp.p: My story begins in the dot com crash in the early '90s.

body.stage: The animatronic sparks, then goes limp.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: whispering to Morty You can put your fingers wherever you want...

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: through speakerMorty, you wanna put it on mute or something? Annie and Morty both look at Morty's helmet, startled.

body.stage: Trans. Garage
Rick is working on a computer, still talking to Morty through his headset.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: I'm trying to concentrate.

body.stage: Jerry wanders to the door.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Ah, Rick?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: holds up a hand without even looking over at him Not now, Jerry. I've got much, much smaller fish to fry.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: enters anyway I wanted to say I'm sorry I ever judged you. leans on the ping pong table, looking down at Ruben's corpse Right now, you're my sanest relative.

body.stage: Rick, who had been typing away, suddenly pauses.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Relative... That's it! Relative size! Jerry, hand me a scalpel and a bundle of dynamite! into his headset Morty! Can you get to the left nipple?

body.stage: Trans. Anatomy Park
Annie is in Morty's lap.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Are you kidding? I'm hoping I can get to both of them, Rick.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: through speakerMorty, I'm talkin' about Ruben's left nipple!

body.stage: The area begins to rumble and cave in. Morty lifts Annie off his lap and both put on their helmets.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: We need to get to the left nipple!

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: The body is decaying! Bits of debris begin to fall from the 'ceiling'. The arterial transit system is useless! We can try the service shuttle. It's connected to the skeletal system. That's why we call it the Bone Train. to Annie Would you like to ride the Bone Train, miss?

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: If it'll get us out of here.

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: How about you, Morty? Would you like to ride the Bone Train?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Why are you doing this bit? We're gonna die. Let's go.

body.stage: Trans. Garage
Jerry looks on as Rick inserts a bundle of dynamite into an incision on Ruben's abdomen. He takes a few steps back toward the door back to the house.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Well, I can see that you're busy... Merry Christmas, Rick.

body.stage: Rick lifts Ruben's corpse from the table and heads out to the car, dumping Ruben's body inside.
Trans. Anatomy Park: the Bone Train

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: There's no autopilot. One of us will have to stay here and operate it manually.

body.stage: Morty and Annie glance at each other, then look back at Dr. Bloom. Dr. Bloom glances at each of the teenagers. Morty and Annie continue staring at him.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: ...Uh, well...

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: No, you're right. It was a dick move for me to even pause like that. This is all my fault. You go on.

body.stage: Something approaches the group from a nearby set of stairs.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: points What the hell is that?

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: E. coli outbreak. Hurry!

body.stage: Morty and Annie jump into the shuttle as E. coli swarm the area. Dr. Bloom pulls a lever and the shuttle begins to move.

sp.speaker: Dr. Bloom
sp.p: Oh wait, there is an autopilot. E. coli surround him. WAAAIT! ...OKAY, NEVER MIND, I WANTED TO SACRIFICE MYSELF ANYWAAAAAYYYY!

body.stage: As the train speeds down the track, some of the E. coli have attached themselves to the vehicle. One smashes the window of the train door and sticks its head inside.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: They're chewing through the doors!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Euuuugh! grabs a fire extinguisher and beats the E. coli off the train with it We're in the areola, Rick! Almost to the nipple! But we're also in a really bad situation!

body.stage: Trans. Earth's orbit
Rick flies his spacecraft out of Earth's atmosphere.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: I'm almost there, Morty!

body.stage: Rick lights the end of the dynamite bundle in Ruben's abdomen, kicks him out into space, and uses a growth ray to increase Ruben to an enormous size—large enough to make Morty and Annie their normal sizes again, but still inside him.
Trans. Earth
Various people across America stop what they're doing and look at the sky as Ruben's huge, naked corpse hovers overhead.

sp.speaker: Reporter
sp.p: Reports are coming in from across the country about what appears to be a giant naked man over the continental United States. We now go to Tom Randolph in New York. Tom?

body.stage: As Tom speaks, Ruben's terrifyingly enormous face floats overhead.

sp.speaker: Tom
sp.p: Well, his eyes aren't twinkling, and his dimples aren't merry, but I'm standing under a nose like a seventy-mile cherry!

sp.speaker: Reporter
sp.p: Thank you, Tom. Let's go now to Eric McMan in Los Angeles.

body.stage: Ruben's poorly kept toes hover in the background while Eric speaks.

sp.speaker: Eric
sp.p: We've got feet here on the West Coast, Bill! Giant feet, even relative to the giant man's size! And you know what they say about that!

sp.speaker: Reporter
sp.p: Well, if the old adage is true, one can only wonder what is going down in the Rocky Mountains.

body.stage: Trans. Rocky Mountains
A lumberjack pauses while hacking down a tree, looks up, screams, and runs away.
Trans. Earth's orbit
Rick flies his ship toward the nipple.
Trans. Bone Train
E. coli continue trying to break in, with Morty beating them away with a fire extinguisher. Running up to the front of the train, he and Annie see that Hepatitis A is has damaged the track.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh my god, the track!

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: It's Hepatitis A!

body.stage: As Morty tries to slow the train down, it flies off the track and straight through some of Ruben's soft tissue, bursting into the nipple. The train hits a bump, throwing Morty and Annie out. They look up and gasp.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: The nipple hole...

body.stage: Through the nipple hole, they're able to see Earth as the sun peeks over the horizon.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: It's beautiful...

body.stage: Suddenly, there's a crash behind them. Hepatitis A bursts out from the train wreckage and lumbers towards Morty and Annie.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: Aw no!

body.stage: The two run, and just as Hepatitis A is about to catch them, Hepatitis C snatches it up and shakes it like felled prey.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: Whoa! It's Hepatitis C!

body.stage: Hepatitis C gives them a thumbs-up before lumbering away with its kill in its mouth.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Um... We... Did we have some sort of relationship with him?

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: I... think they're just like that? I think they're just good guys.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh. Huh.

body.stage: Rick flies his spaceship into the nipple, landing it behind them. Morty and Annie climb inside.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Where's Dr. Bloom?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Sorry Rick... He's dead...

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Goddamn it, Morty, I ask you to do one thing!

body.stage: Rick flies the spaceship out of the nipple and away from Ruben's corpse just before the dynamite ignites and the body explodes, sending blood and gore in all directions.
Trans. Smith residence
Joyce, Leonard, Jacob, Beth, Summer, and Ethan all bundle up to go sledding.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Jerry doesn't know what he's missing.

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: He'll come around, Beth. Christmas is a special time. It has funny ways of bringing families together.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: I dunno, Jacob. Jerry got an invitation to be alive today, and he rejected it. I don't know if our marriage will—

body.stage: Beth stops talking as blood starts splattering the sliding glass doors. The whole group stares in shock as blood seems to pour from the sky.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: It's raining blood!

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: Listen, find Jerry!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Oh god.

body.stage: Trans. Jerry's den
Blood is raining on the window there as well. Jerry is sitting in a chair, watching the news, when the family bursts in.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Jerry!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: stands and hugs her It's alright! The TV says there's nothing to worry about.

sp.speaker: Reporter on TV
sp.p: The giant naked sky Santa has exploded. Blood and chunks of viscera are raining down on the country. Everything should be fine.

body.stage: Family sighs in relief.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Dad, can I have my phone back?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Sure, sweetie. pulls out the stocking and gives Summer her phone, then gives Beth her tablet Everybody, take a device. It'll help you relax.

sp.speaker: Jacob
sp.p: This is nice.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Yeah. puts an arm around Beth and Jacob I guess we really learned something this Christmas, Jacob.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: No we didn't, Dad. No we didn't.

body.stage: Trans. Smith house
It's no longer raining blood, but reddish chunks of Ruben are everywhere as Rick lands his spacecraft, parking it in the garage.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Too bad about Dr. Bloom. Rick, Annie, and Morty exit the car He was a genius. The only man capable of creating a new Anatomy Park.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: Actually, I studied Dr. Bloom's work. I believe I have the knowledge necessary to create a new, much safer park!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: What about Pirates of the Pancreas...?

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: I think it was one of the most underrated attractions.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Booyah! Hold your breath!

body.stage: Annie is already standing under the shrink ray as Rick pulls the lever, shrinking her down to microscopic size once again, much to Morty's chagrin.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Hey, wh-wh- What the hell, Rick? What the hell, man? I liked her! I really had somethin' going there, Rick!

body.stage: Rick pockets the container holding Annie.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah, so I heard. You dodged a bullet, Morty, trust me. whispers Puffy vagina.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: W-What's wrong with that? That doesn't sound like a problem to me! I dunno!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: C'mon. Let's get some stuffing, I'm starving.

body.stage: Trans. Smith family living room

Beth, Leonard, Summer, and Ethan sit on the couch, Jacob sits in the easy chair with Joyce in his lap, and Jerry sits on the carpet. All are staring at handheld electronics as Rick and Morty enter the room.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, unbelievable. We got a bunch of robot computer people sittin' around with their faces stuffed in computer screens. No one acknowledges him. Do you realize Christ was born today? Jesus Christ our Savior was born today! A-A-A-Are you people even human? What kind of Christmas is this?

body.stage: Jerry looks at the audience and shrugs.
End Credits roll
Trans. Rick's garage

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: through speaker phoneHey Rick! Rick, can you hear me?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Loud and clear, Annie.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: Great! We're also on with Alejandro, our Chief Imaginarian—

sp.speaker: Alejandro
sp.p: Hey Rick.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: Natalie Jacobs and Chris Desiter from Microscopic Marketing, Zach from Organ Concepts and Jamie from New Media.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Hey everybody.

sp.speaker: All
sp.p: Hey, hi Rick, how's it goin'. etc.

sp.speaker: Annie
sp.p: So. Pirates of the Pancreas.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah, talk to me.

sp.speaker: Alejandro
sp.p: Hey Rick, it's Alejandro speaking. Um, so we asked ourselves internally, we asked ourselves over here, “Okay, what does a pancreas do?” Rick begins to look agitated. And the answer was, does it make pirates? No. It makes insulin, you know? So we're starting with a new—

body.stage: Rick, furious, picks up and slams the phone, hanging up on the group call. Behind him, Ethan lies on a table.

sp.speaker: Ethan
sp.p: So those guys are inside me, huh? Like, building a park?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Those guys are inside you building a piece of shit, Ethan! They're inside you building a monument to compromise! Fuck. Fuck those people. Fuck this whole thing, Ethan.

sp.speaker: Ethan
sp.p: ... Cool. And who pays me?
